resources.string: Thank you for choosing Journey. This page will help you use Journey so that you can get the most out of it.

The opening screen of Journey is a Map that centers on your current location. You can navigate the map just like you would navigate the map in Google Maps. From here, you can:
 1. Access the Navigation Drawer
 2. Start a new Road Trip
 3. Join a Road Trip that has already been set up

The Navigation Drawer contains pages that need to be easily accessible from the Home Screen. The Navigation Drawer contains the following pages:
 1. Login / Logout - Click this to either login or logout of Journey
 2. Settings - Use this page to change application settings, such as the maximum distance from your route that you would like to stop
 3. Help - This is the page you are currently on. This page contains information about using Journey
 4. About - The About page is a page created by us, the developers, so you can learn a bit more about us and about Journey

The Start Road Trip page is where you will create the road trip that you would like to navigate. There are three important aspects to this page:
 1. Starting Destination - Enter the place you would like to start your road trip from
 2. Final Destination - Not the Super Smash Bros. map! Enter the place that you would like to end your road trip 3. Caravan Trip - If you select this, your trip will become available for others to join. If you do this, once the trip starts you will be deemed the "Trip Admin", while everyone who joined your trip will be "Trip Passengers" (?)
 Once finished, press the Begin Road Trip button to start the road trip!
The Join Road Trip page is where you will find a road trip, created by our application, to join.\n * Page WIP *

Once you have either created or joined a trip, you will be brought back to the Home Screen (with the map), but there are a few different options now:
 1. Your route is displayed on the map as a line. * Additional info about route WIP *
 2. To add a stop to your route (Trip Admin) or request a stop (Trip Passenger), press the Add/Request Stop button
 	Note: If you are driving, we advise you to use the voice control option so that you may focus on the road
 3. To use voice controls to add/request a route stop, press the microphone button on the right side of the display * Commands WIP *
Please enter the email address of the person who created the trip below.
